title-group.article-title: Učinkovitost medskalenske blokade brahialnega pleteža pri lajšanju pooperacijske bolečine po artroskopski rekonstrukciji rotacijske manšete: Retrospektivna raziskava

trans-title-group.trans-title: The efficacy of an interscalene brachial plexus block in relieving postoperative pain after an arthroscopic rotator cuff reconstruction: Retrospective study

abstract.title: Izvleček
abstract.p: Izhodišče: Raztrganje rotacijske manšete (RM) je med najpogostejšimi vzroki za artroskopsko operacijo rame (AOR). Bistveno za uspešno okrevanje je gibanje uda, ki je odvisno od dobro nadzorovane pooperacijske bolečine (PB). Preverjali smo učinkovitost medskalenske blokade brahialnega pleteža (angl. Interscalene Brachial Plexus Block, ISB) pri lajšanju PB v domačem okolju predvsem med gibanjem. Raziskava nas bo opozorila na pomanjkljivosti metode ter morebitno potrebo po prilagoditvi zdravljenja bolečine po operaciji.

Metode: Retrospektivno smo analizirali dokumentacijo 150 bolnikov po artroskopski rekonstrukciji RM. Z ultrazvočno vodeno ISB so prejeli 12–30 mL levobupivakaina z deksametazonom. Stopnjo PB so ocenjevali z vizualno analogno lestvico (VAS). Preučili smo demografske in klinične značilnosti bolnikov, trajanje ISB ter porabo protibolečinskih zdravil. Primerjali smo vrednosti VAS v mirovanju in med gibanjem do 90 ur po operaciji ter s tem ocenili vpliv gibanja na stopnjo PB. Zanimalo nas je tudi zadovoljstvo bolnikov s posegom. Pri primerjavi vrednosti VAS med opisnimi spremenljivkami smo uporabili Wilcoxonov test vsote rangov. Pri analizi meritev pri istem bolniku smo uporabili dvosmerno analizo varianc (ANOVA) za ponovljene meritve. Za mejo statistične značilnosti smo upoštevali p < 0,05.

Rezultati: ISB je v povprečju trajala 24–36 ur. Skupno so bolniki v prvih treh dneh po operaciji, tj. pooperacijskih dneh (POD), potrebovali 77 dodatnih odmerkov opioidnih in 104 dodatnih odmerkov neopioidnih analgetikov. Mediana vrednost VAS zgodnje PB je bila tako v mirovanju kot med gibanjem 0. PB je bila na prvi POD med gibanjem 0,5 in v mirovanju 1, na drugi POD 2 in 3, na tretji POD 2 in 2. Med PB v mirovanju in med gibanjem nismo ugotovili značilnih razlik (p > 0,05; ANOVA za ponovljene meritve). Bolniki so počutje med operacijo, na oddelku in doma največkrat označili kot sproščeno.

Zaključek: ISB je učinkovita pri lajšanju PB po artroskopski rekonstrukciji RM zunaj bolnišnice in zagotavlja več kot 24-urno analgezijo. Predpisano protibolečinsko zdravljenje zadostuje pri nadzoru PB. Vrednosti VAS so zadovoljive in med gibanjem primerljive z ocenami v mirovanju. ISB je zanesljiva in učinkovita, bolniki so zadovoljni, zato ocenjujemo, da je najprimernejša metoda pri artroskopski operaciji rame (AOR) in po njej.

trans-abstract.title: Abstract
trans-abstract.p: Background: Rotator cuff tears are among the most common causes for an arthroscopic shoulder surgery. Movement of the limb is essential for successful recovery and paramount for well controlled postoperative pain (POP). The efficacy of the interscalene brachial plexus block (ISB) in relieving POP in homecare setting was evaluated. The research is expected to call our attention to the shortcomings of ISB and point out a possible need to adjust the prescribed oral analgesic therapy.

Methods: A retrospective analysis of 150 patients was conducted. They had all undergone arthroscopic shoulder surgery due to the rotator cuff tear and received 12–30 mL levobupivacaine with dexamethasone preoperatively with ultrasound-guided ISB. POP was assessed with the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS). Patients’ demographical and clinical features were assessed as well as the duration of ISB and the analgesics consumption. VAS values were analysed 90 hours after surgery at rest and on movement. Patients’ satisfaction was assessed as well. Wilcoxon rank-sum test was used for comparison of the VAS values between descriptive variables. In the analysis of different levels of POP within the same patient, Repeated Measures Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) was used. A value of p < 0.05 was considered statistically significant.

Results: The mean duration of ISB effect was 24–36 hours. In total, 77 additional doses of opioids and 104 doses of non-opioid analgesics were required during the first three post-operative days (POD). The median VAS value of the early POP was 0, both at rest and on movement. POP was 0.5 on movement and 1 at rest on the first POD, 2 and 3 on the second POD, 2 and 2 on the third POD. No significant differences were found between POP on movement and at rest (p > 0.05; Repeated Measures ANOVA). Most patients had been comfortable during surgery as well as later on the ward and at home.

Conclusion: ISB is effective in relieving POP after arthroscopic rotator cuff repair in home care after hospital discharge. It provides more than 24-hour analgesia, but can cause intra-operative haemodynamic instability. The prescribed analgesic therapy is efficient. VAS values are satisfactory at rest and on movement. ISB is safe, uncomplicated and reliable in addition to high patients’ satisfaction. We conclude that ISB is the most appropriate method for arthroscopic shoulder surgery.

sec.title: Uvod
sec.p: Bolečina v rami je tretje najpogostejša bolezen kostno-mišičnega sistema, ki povzroča veliko socialno-ekonomsko obremenitev, saj prizadene 67 % populacije (1). Med najpogostejšimi vzroki za bolečino v rami je raztrganje tetiv mišic rotacijske manšete (RM), ki se pojavi pri 13 % ljudi, starejših od 50 let, in pri 50 % ljudi, starejših od 80 let (2). Cilj kirurškega zdravljenja raztrganja RM je zmanjšanje bolečine s sočasnim izboljšanjem funkcije (3). Strokovnjaki dajejo pri artroskopski operaciji rame (AOR) prednost področni anesteziji, saj omogoča odlično mišično relaksacijo, manjšo izgubo krvi, krajši čas zdravljenja v bolnišnici in zmanjša potrebo po analgetikih med in po operaciji. Predvsem pa zmanjša tveganje za hipotenzijo med operacijo ter s tem za zmanjšano prekrvitev osrednjega živčevja, kar je pri AOR v polsedečem kirurškem položaju posebej pomembno (4).

Pooperacijska bolečina (PB) je akutna bolečina, ki jo opredelimo kot biokemično in vedenjsko kaskado, ki se sprožita zaradi odziva na poškodbo tkiva pri operaciji (5,6). AOR je po navedbah nemške raziskave na 70. mestu po stopnji PB na prvi pooperacijski dan (POD) (6). Slabo nadzorovana PB je poleg razvoja v kronično obliko povezana s pojavom globoke venske tromboze, pljučne embolije, ishemije srčne mišice, miokardnega infarkta in pljučnice, s slabim celjenjem rane, z nespečnostjo ter s povečano obolevnostjo in smrtnostjo. Ob tem se pojavijo gospodarske in zdravstvene posledice ter nezadovoljstvo bolnikov z zdravstveno oskrbo (6,7). Predvsem pri ortopedskih posegih je bistveno, da se PB dobro nadzoruje, saj morajo biti bolniki sicer sprejeti v bolnišnico, namesto da bi jih že na dan posega odpustili v domačo oskrbo, prav tako pa PB podaljša čas okrevanja (8).

Blokade perifernih živcev so zaradi svoje učinkovitosti zelo priljubljene metode za lajšanje PB. Poznamo različne pristope in tehnike, pri katerih se uporabljajo različne količine in vrste lokalnih anestetikov (LA) (9). Najpogosteje uporabljeni in kot samostojni tudi najučinkovitejši je pristop do brahialnega pleteža med skalenskima mišicama, imenovan medskalenska blokada brahialnega pleteža (angl. Interscalene Brachial Plexus Block, ISB) (10). Vsi živci, ki so pomembni pri operaciji RM, izhajajo iz vratnih korenin C5 in C6, torej iz zadnjega in zgornjega debla brahialnega pleteža. Iz teh osnov izhaja temelj metode ISB, pri kateri anesteziolog cilja brahialni pletež na ravni njegovih debel in s tem uspešno blokira več perifernih živcev hkrati (10). Najbolj neposreden pristop do brahialnega pleteža v področju med sprednjo in srednjo skalensko mišico ostaja tehnika Winnie, ki je od prvega opisa leta 1970 doživela nekaj modifikacij (11,12).

V klinični praksi največkrat uporabimo multimodalni pristop, kar pomeni sočasno uporabo različnih lokalnih in sistemskih metod za lajšanje bolečine. Kombinacija paracetamola, nesteroidnih antirevmatikov (NSAR) in šibkih opioidnih analgetikov z živčnimi blokadami zagotavlja učinkovito lajšanje PB. Bolnik lahko še na dan posega zapusti bolnišnico ter varno in neboleče okreva v domačem okolju (13).

Z retrospektivno raziskavo smo želeli preveriti, kako učinkovita je metoda ISB, ki se rutinsko uporablja pri AOR za lajšanje PB, zunaj bolnišnice. Ugotavljali smo, ali dosega dovolj dolg analgetični učinek brez sočasne motorične blokade, ki pomembno ovira čim prejšnje okrevanje. V ta namen smo ocenjevali učinkovitost ISB pri lajšanju PB v različnih časovnih presledkih po AOR tako v mirovanju kot med gibanjem operiranega uda ter preučili morebitni vpliv aktivnosti na PB. Rezultati analize nam bodo v pomoč pri razvoju hipotez za prospektivno študijo, s katero bomo lahko še natančneje preučili PB med gibanjem in fizikalno terapijo.

sec.title: Zasnova raziskave
sec.p: Izvedli smo retrospektivno raziskavo, v kateri smo ocenjevali učinkovitost ISB pri lajšanju PB po artroskopski rekonstrukciji RM. Analiza smo izvajali v času od maja 2017 do avgusta 2018 v sodelovanju z Arbor mea d. o. o. in Kirurgijo Bitenc d. o. o. Pred pričetkom analize za izvedbo raziskave smo 23. januarja 2018 pridobili soglasje Komisije Republike Slovenije za medicinsko etiko (0120-628/2017/6). Bolniki, ki smo jih vključili v raziskavo, so pred posegom soglašali z metodo ISB in so bili starejši od 18 let. Anesteziral jih je isti anesteziolog in operiral isti kirurg. Naknadno smo izključili bolnike, ki niso bili operirani zaradi raztrganja RM rame, in tiste, ki so oddali pomanjkljivo izpolnjene vprašalnike. Retrospektivno smo analizirali podatke 150 bolnikov z napotitveno klinično diagnozo raztrganje RM rame, pri katerih je kirurg v polsedečem kirurškem položaju artroskopsko rekonstruiral RM in sočasno opravil subakromialno dekompresijo (Slika 1).

fig.label: Slika 1:

caption.p: Diagram poteka izbora bolnikov za retrospektivno analizo.

fig.p: Legenda: AOR (artroskopska operacija rame), RM (rotatorna manšeta), ISB (medskalenska blokada brahialnega pleteža – angl. Interscalene Brachial Plexus Block).

sec.title: Praktični del raziskave
sec.p: ISB smo izvedli z uporabo UZ po modificirani metodi Winnie (14). Pri blokadi smo glede na telesno težo bolnika uporabili 12–30 mL 0,5-odstotne raztopine LA levobupivakaina z dodatkom 8 mg deksametazona. Učinkovitost blokade smo ocenili 15 in 30 minut po izvedbi ISB. Med operacijo smo bolnike sedirali z 1 mg/kg/h propofola in 0,01 μg/kg/min remifentanila. Bolnikom smo ves čas nadzorovali vitalne funkcije. V primeru, da je nasičenost krvi s kisikom padla pod 93 %, so bolniki preko obrazne maske dobili dodatni kisik (Slika 2 in Slik).

fig.label: Slika 2:

caption.p: Simulacija izvedbe medskalenske blokade brahialnega pleteža z ultrazvokom.

fig.p: Pri simulaciji izvedbe medskalenske blokade brahialnega pleteža anesteziolog prikazuje mesto vboda. Avtor: Ana Kisovar.

fig.label: Slika 3:

caption.p: Ultrazvočni prikaz brahialnega pleteža med sprednjo in srednjo skalensko mišico.

fig.p: Legenda: SA (sprednja skalenska mišica), SM (srednja skalenska mišica), SCM (sternokleidomastoidna mišica), C5–C7 (vratni spinalni živci). Vir: Arhiv Kirurgije Bitenc d. o. o.

sec.p: Bolniki so na dan operacije skupaj z navodili prejeli vprašalnik za ocenjevanje PB, ki so ga začeli izpolnjevati dve uri po posegu. Oceno PB so bolniki na vprašalniku podali z uporabo vrednosti vizualne analogne lestvice (angl. Visual Analogue Scale, VAS). Iz bolnišnice so bili z natančnimi navodili za okrevanje praviloma odpuščeni še isti dan, ko so dosegli zadovoljivo oceno po točkovnem sistemu Aldrete (15).

Vsi bolniki naj bi 12 ur po izvedbi ISB prvič vzeli oralni analgetik metamizol 500 mg. Protibolečinsko zdravljenje za naslednje 3 dni je predstavljeno v tabeli (Tabela 1). Bolnikom s predhodnimi težavami pri jemanju NSAR smo namesto diklofenaka predpisali tramadol s paracetamolom. Če predpisana zdravila niso zadostovala, smo bolnikom po potrebi svetovali dodatno protibolečinsko zdravljenje (Tabela 2, Slika 5).

caption.p: Predpisano protibolečinsko zdravljenje po operaciji.
Predpisano dodatno protibolečinsko zdravljenje po operaciji.

tr.td: Ob srednje hudi blečini do 8 tablet

sec.title: Analitični del raziskave
sec.p: Podatke smo zbrali s pomočjo anestezijskega lista in lista področne anestezije ter vprašalnika. Z anestezijskega lista in lista področne anestezije smo pridobili podatke o: diagnozi, zaradi katere je bolnik potreboval operacijo, vrsti in količini LA, spremljajočih boleznih in oceni ASA (lestvica ocene tveganja – angl. Physical Status Classification from American Society of Anesthesiologists). Z vprašalnika smo poleg ocene PB v mirovanju in med gibanjem pridobili podatke o subjektivni oceni bolnikovega počutja in bolečini med izvedbo bloka, med operacijo, po operaciji na oddelku ter trajanju ISB. Pri beleženju zgodnje PB smo upoštevali ocene na dan operacije, to je do 12 ur po operaciji, za prvi pooperacijski dan smo upoštevali čas 18–36 ur po posegu, za drugi POD 42–60 ur po posegu in za tretji POD 66–90 ur po posegu.

Za statistično analizo podatkov smo uporabili Statistical Package for the Social Sciences 23.0. Spremenljivke s številkami smo poleg M ± SD opisali tudi z Me in IQR. Vrednost VAS smo pri oceni razlik obravnavali kot nenormalno razporejeno razmernostno številsko spremenljivko, a smo zaradi lažje primerjave z nekaterimi podatki iz literature vedno navedli tudi povprečno vrednost (angl. Mean, M) s standardnim odklonom (angl. Standard Deviation, SD) (16,17). Pri primerjavi vrednosti VAS z opisnimi spremenljivkami smo uporabili Wilcoxonov test vsote rangov in Kruskal-Wallisov H-test. Pri analizi meritev, opravljenih pri istem bolniku, smo glede na priporočila brez ali s predhodno normalizacijo uporabili dvosmerno analizo varianc (angl. Analysis of Variance, ANOVA) za ponovljene meritve (17). Za mejo statistične značilnosti smo upoštevali p < 0,05.

sec.title: Značilnosti preiskovancev
sec.p: Retrospektivno smo analizirali 150 bolnikov po AOR zaradi raztrganja RM, od tega 88 (59 %) moških in 62 (41 %) žensk. Demografske in klinične značilnosti bolnikov so prikazane v tabelah (Tabela 3 in Tabela 4) (Slika 4).

caption.p: Demografske značilnosti preiskovancev.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legenda: M (povprečna vrednost), SD (standardni odklon), Min (najnižja vrednost), Max (najvišja vrednost), Me (mediana), IZ (interval zaupanja), IQR (medkvartilni razmik).

caption.p: Lestvica ocene tveganja.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legenda: ASA (angl. Physical Status Classification from American Society of Anesthesiologists), n (število bolnikov), d (delež bolnikov).

caption.p: Histogram časa po operaciji do prvega zabeleženega VAS > 0.

sec.title: Trajanje blokade
sec.p: Trajanje ISB smo ocenjevali na dva načina. Za prvo oceno časa trajanja ISB smo pri vsakem bolniku zabeležili časovni interval od ure izvedbe ISB do ure, ki jo je bolnik zabeležil kot čas, ko je roko v celoti čutil tako kot pred izvedbo ISB. Po tej oceni je ISB v povprečju trajala 31 ± 8 ur (Me = 29; IQR = 9). Najkrajši čas ocene trajanja je bil 18 ur in najdaljši 55 ur.

21 bolnikov v poteku po operaciji ni zabeležilo VAS > 0, zato jih pri drugi oceni nismo upoštevali. Pri 129 bolnikih smo razbrali časovni interval, v katerem so v času okrevanja po operaciji prvič zabeležili VAS > 0 (Slika 4). Ugotovili smo, da je pri drugi oceni trajanja v časovnem intervalu med 24–36 ur PB prvič začutilo 71 (56 %) bolnikov, kar se ujema z medkvartilnim presledkom iz prve ocene (25–34 ur). Iz primerjave obeh ocen trajanja ISB lahko sklepamo, da blokada povprečno drži 24–36 ur.

sec.title: Zgodnja bolečina po operaciji
sec.p: Kot zgodnjo PB smo opredelili bolečino do 12 ur po kirurškem posegu, kar pomeni PB na dan operacije. Bolniki so beležili vrednosti VAS v dveurnih intervalih po operaciji ter ob tem poročali o aktivnosti, umestitvi in morebitni potrebi po dodatnih analgetikih. Učinkovitost ISB smo preverjali tako v mirovanju kot med gibanjem, zato smo pri bolnikih analizirali najvišje zabeležene vrednosti VAS na dan operacije glede na aktivnost (Slika 5). Povprečje najvišjih vrednosti VAS s standardnim odklonom je bilo v mirovanju 0,8 ± 1,7 in med gibanjem 0,7 ± 1,7. S primerjavo vrednosti nismo ugotovili statistično značilnih razlik (p = 0,860; Wilcoxonov test vsote rangov).

fig.label: Slika 5:

caption.p: Grafični prikaz najvišje stopnje bolečine na dan operacije v mirovanju in med gibanjem.

fig.p: Najvišja vrednost VAS na dan operacije glede na aktivnost je izražena z mediano (debelejša daljša črta) in medkvartilnim razmikom (tanjša krajša črta). Pike in kvadratki prikazujejo posamezne ocene bolnikov. Med vrednostmi ni statistično značilnih razlik (p > 0,05; Wilcoxonov test vsote rangov).

sec.p: Na dan operacije je dodaten odmerek analgetikov potrebovalo 6 (2 %) bolnikov. Večinoma so posegli po analginu ali diklofenaku, en bolnik pa je na dan operacije na oddelku prejel piritramid.

sec.title: Pozna bolečina po operaciji
sec.p: Kot pozno PB smo opredelili bolečino od 18 ur po operaciji dalje oziroma v prvih treh POD (Tabela 5, Tabela 6, Tabela 7). Bolniki so za oceno pozne PB beležili vrednosti VAS v šesturnih presledkih (Slika 6) ter ob tem poročali o aktivnosti in morebitni potrebi po dodatnih analgetikih.

caption.p: Vrednosti VAS na prvi dan po operaciji.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legenda: VAS (vizualna analogna lestvica), n (število odgovorov), M (povprečna vrednost), SD (standardni odklon), Min (najnižja vrednost), Max (najvišja vrednost), Me (mediana), IQR (medkvartilni razmik).

caption.p: Vrednosti VAS na drugi dan po operaciji.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legenda: VAS (vizualna analogna lestvica), n (število odgovorov), M (povprečna vrednost), SD (standardni odklon), Min (najnižja vrednost), Max (najvišja vrednost), Me (mediana), IQR (medkvartilni razmik).

caption.p: Vrednosti VAS na tretji dan po operaciji.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legenda: VAS (vizualna analogna lestvica), n (število odgovorov), M (povprečna vrednost), SD (standardni odklon), Min (najnižja vrednost), Max (najvišja vrednost), Me (mediana), IQR (medkvartilni razmik).

fig.label: Slika 6:

caption.p: Grafični prikaz spreminjanja vrednosti VAS v urah po operaciji.

fig.p: Neprekinjena črta povezuje mediane vrednosti VAS (vizualna analogna lestvica – barvna pika) z medkvartilnim razmikom (tanjša krajša črta) v urah po operaciji pri vseh bolnikih skupaj, ne glede na aktivnost. Mediane v istem dnevu so prikazane z isto barvo.

sec.p: Poleg predpisanih zdravil so bolniki beležili tudi porabo dodatnih analgetikov (Slika 7 in Slika 8). Bolniki so v prvih treh dneh po operaciji potrebovali 77 dodatnih odmerkov opioidnih analgetikov in 104 dodatne odmerke neopioidnih analgetikov. Na prvi POD je 10 (7 %) bolnikov potrebovalo dodaten odmerek opioidnega in 18 (12 %) bolnikov dodaten odmerek neopioidnega analgetika. V povprečju so potrebovali 0,09 dodatnega odmerka opioidnega in 0,17 dodatnega odmerka neopioidnega analgetika na bolnika. Na drugi POD je 15 (10 %) bolnikov potrebovalo dodaten odmerek opioidnega in 28 (19 %) bolnikov dodaten odmerek neopioidnega analgetika. V povprečju so potrebovali 0,21 dodatnega odmerka opioidnega in 0,27 dodatnega odmerka neopioidnega analgetika na bolnika. Na tretji POD je 10 (7 %) bolnikov potrebovalo dodaten odmerek opioidnega in 22 (15 %) bolnikov dodaten odmerek neopioidnega analgetika. V povprečju so potrebovali 0,21 dodatnega odmerka opioidnega in 0,26 dodatnega odmerka neopioidnega analgetika na bolnika.

fig.label: Slika 7:

caption.p: Histogram porabe dodatnih odmerkov opioidnih analgetikov po operaciji.

fig.p: Bolniki so v prvih treh dneh po operaciji skupaj potrebovali 77 dodatnih odmerkov opioidnih analgetikov.

sec.sec-type: Vpliv gibanja na stopnjo bolečine po operaciji
sec.title: Vpliv gibanja na stopnjo bolečine po operaciji
sec.p: Iz vprašalnikov smo razbrali ure, v katerih so bolniki po operaciji prvič začeli gibati z roko (Slika 9), da bi s tem lahko grafično primerjali razporeditev bolnikov, ki so v urah po operaciji PB ocenili z VAS ≥ 4 (Slika 10).

caption.p: Histogram števila bolnikov, ki so v urah po operaciji začeli z gibanjem.
Histogram števila bolnikov, ki so v urah po operaciji bolečino ocenili z VAS ≥ 4.

sec.p: Posebej smo analizirali vrednosti VAS pri bolnikih, ki so v istem dnevu ocenili PB tako v mirovanju kot med gibanjem (Tabela 8), a statistično značilnih razlik nismo ugotovili (p > 0,05; ANOVA za ponovljene meritve).

caption.p: Najvišje vrednosti VAS v mirovanju in med gibanjem pri bolnikih, ki so v istem dnevu ocenili stopnjo bolečine pri obeh aktivnostih.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legenda: Max (najvišja vrednost), VAS (vizualna analogna lestvica), n (število bolnikov), M (povprečna vrednost), SD (standardni odklon), Me (mediana), IQR (medkvartilni razmik), p (p-vrednost), POD (pooperacijski dan).

sec.title: Splošno počutje in zadovoljstvo bolnikov
sec.p: Z zelo nelagodno je počutje med operacijo ocenil bolnik, ki je kot nelagodno označil tudi počutje med izvajanjem blokade ter bolečino med blokiranjem ocenil z VAS 4–6. Kot zelo nelagodno je počutje doma označilo 5 bolnikov, ki so na prvi, drugi in tretji POD PB ocenili z VAS > 5. 39 (26 %) bolnikov je svoje zadovoljstvo s posegom izrazilo s pisno pohvalo celotni zdravstveni ekipi (Slika 11).

caption.p: Histogram splošnega počutja bolnikov med operacijo, na oddelku in doma.

sec.title: Razpravljanje
sec.p: Učinkovito lajšanje PB pomeni, da protibolečinska metoda enostavno in zanesljivo zagotavlja dober nadzor PB, kar izkustveno in po navedbah literature pomeni vrednosti VAS < 4 (18). ISB se rutinsko uporablja pri AOR in se je izkazala kot učinkovita do 24 ur po posegu (19-23). V navedenih raziskavah avtorji niso ocenjevali bolečine med gibanjem oziroma med izvajanjem fizioterapevtskih vaj, kar je ključno za uspešno okrevanje. Nekateri avtorji navajajo, da naj bi bila PB med gibanjem večja kot v mirovanju in naj bi se še povečala pri aktivnostih z roko nad glavo (24,25). Manj poznana je tudi učinkovitost protibolečinske terapije po operaciji zunaj bolnišnice, saj je znano, da bolniki po tovrstnih operacijah občutijo zmerno (VAS = 4–6) do hudo (VAS = 7–9) PB več kot 48 ur po posegu, ko praviloma že okrevajo v domačem okolju (14).

sec.title: Trajanje enkratne blokade
sec.p: Trajanje blokade je odvisno od volumna, koncentracije in vrste LA ter od dodanih učinkovin (19,26-31). Trajanje blokade je v raziskavah brez uporabe dodatka kortikosteroidov občutno krajše kot pri naših bolnikih (14,21,22,31). O nekoliko daljšem trajanju poročajo avtorji, ki so LA dodali deksametazon. Tanaka in sodelavci (sod.) z 20 mL 0,75-odstotnega ropivakaina in dodatkom deksametazona navajajo mediano 18 ur, medtem ko so Cummings in sod. poročali o mediani 22,4 ur (32), a so pri tem uporabili 30 mL 0,75-odstotnega ropivakaina. Omenjenim avtorjem pritrjujejo nekatere najnovejše ugotovitve o tem, da kortikosteroidi podaljšajo čas delovanja LA in hkrati nasprotujejo raziskave, ki učinek bodisi sistemskega bodisi lokalnega dodatka kortikosteroidov na čas trajanja perinevralne blokade postavljajo pod vprašaj (33-35).

Vsekakor velikih odstopanj ne glede na njihovo součinkovanje ne moremo pripisati zgolj kortikosteroidom. Razlage prav tako ne moremo iskati v izkušenosti anesteziologa, saj razlike v uspešnosti ISB z UZ glede na izkušenost niso dokazali (36). Najboljšo obrazložitev zaenkrat ponujajo Tangoca in sod., ki so čas trajanja ISB ločili na trajanje analgezije in trajanje motorične blokade. Izmerili so povprečno trajanje analgezije 21,6 ur in povprečno trajanje motorične blokade 36,7 ur (37). Omenimo naj, da so naši bolniki pri oceni časa trajanja ISB odgovarjali na vprašanje Kdaj ste v celoti čutili roko?. To lahko pomeni tako čas do občutenja PB kot tudi čas do povrnitve občutka za dotik ter mišične moči in pojasnjuje razpon zabeleženega časa (18–55 ur). Ugotavljamo, da bi bilo potrebno vprašanje natančneje zastaviti ter da je bilo sovpadanje trajanja analgezije in trajanja motorične ter senzorične blokade verjetno naključje.

Vsekakor je ocena trajanja blokade klinično pomembna, saj je zaželeno, da čas analgezije traja čim dlje, medtem ko želimo, da se motorična moč povrne prej, da lahko bolniki začnejo z razgibavanjem roke. Glede na grafični prikaz (Slika 6) predlagamo, da bolnike vnaprej opozorimo, da se bo PB po 24 urah od posega začela stopnjevati in bo približno 42 ur po posegu dosegla vrhunec. Pri tem moramo posebej poudariti, da naj vsaj do takrat redno jemljejo predpisana protibolečinska zdravila, tudi če bolečine ne občutijo (14).

sec.title: Stopnja bolečine po operaciji
sec.p: Znano je, da bolniki po AOR zaradi raztrganja RM občutijo hudo PB do 48 ur po operaciji (38,39). Mi smo beležili PB do 90 ur in pri primerjavi vključili raziskave, ki so ocenjevale učinkovitost ISB po AOR zaradi raztrganja RM in PB v mirovanju beležile z VAS. Lee in sod. so šest ur po operaciji poročali o povprečni vrednosti 5,2 (40), podobno je bilo v raziskavi Ikemota in sod. 6,27, a so bile vrednosti v nadaljevanju primerljive z našimi (38). Bliže našim vrednostim so bili Desroches in sod., ki so v šestih urah po operaciji poročali o povprečni vrednosti 2,3 (41). Razlike v PB bi morda lahko razložilo dejstvo, da so Lee in sod. pri izvajanju ISB uporabljali živčni stimulator, medtem ko tako Desroches kot Ikemoto s sod. niso uporabili ne UZ, ne živčnega stimulatorja. Znano je namreč, da uporaba UZ izboljša kakovost blokade in podaljša čas njenega delovanja (42). Desroches in sod. beležijo višje povprečne vrednosti na prvi in drugi POD (4,5 in 4,2) ter nekoliko nižje na tretji POD 3,1 (41). Do podobnih rezultatov so prišli tudi Salviz in sod. (43). 24 ur po operaciji so naši bolniki PB ocenili z mediano 0. Rezultati drugih študij so bili tudi v tem obdobju višji. Lee in sod. so poročali o povprečni vrednosti 3,9 (40) ter Ikemoto in sod. o povprečni vrednosti 3,8. Le slednji so v raziskavi ocenjevali tudi PB v 48 urah po operacijah in ugotovili, da je bila povprečna vrednost 3,0 (38), kar je primerljivo z našo mediano. Iz poteka vrednosti VAS sklepamo, da so navedene ISB trajale približno 24 ur. Glede na oceno trajanja ISB se torej pričakuje, da so bolniki v teh raziskavah na prvi POD (24 ur po posegu) beležili višjo PB, medtem ko so naši bolniki najhujšo PB beležili kasneje, na drugi POD (42 ur po posegu). A naj poudarimo, da so ti avtorji tako pri zgodnji kot pozni PB beležili višje stopnje.

Zanimalo nas je, ali bi lahko z neprekinjeno ISB nudili še bolj kakovostno analgezijo. Po navedbah Fredericksona in sod. je ta metoda najučinkovitejša pri lajšanju PB po AOR, saj dajanje LA preko obživčnega katetra podaljša analgezijo po posegu (44). Kljub številnim prednostim so glavne ovire metode pri rutinski rabi nedoslednost pri tehniki izvajanja, podaljšana motorična blokada, izpad katetra, okužbe, okvare črpalke in dejstvo, da je uporaba obživčnega katetra zaenkrat mogoča le pri hospitaliziranih bolnikih (45). V raziskavah z neprekinjeno ISB so na prvi POD avtorji poročali o mediani vrednosti VAS 0, ki je na drugi in tretji POD dosegla vrednost 3. V isti raziskavi so pri enkratni ISB dobili mediane 4, 4 in 3 (46). Zanimivo je, da se učinkovitost neprekinjene metode kaže predvsem v prvih dveh POD, medtem ko se stopnje PB kasneje izenačijo. Naše mediane 1, 3 in 2 so nekoliko višje kot pri omenjeni neprekinjeni ISB, a nižje kot pri enkratni ISB (39,46).

Dobro je, da so naše vrednosti VAS primerljive oziroma nižje kot v podobnih raziskavah tako v času zgodnje kot pozne PB in tudi pri neprekinjeni ISB. Kljub zadovoljivim medianam opazimo, da z upoštevanjem medkvartilnih razmikov po 36 urah vrednosti VAS presegajo mejo, ki smo jo postavili kot zadovoljivo (VAS < 4) (Slika 6). Takrat se tudi močno poveča število bolnikov, ki so PB ocenili z VAS ≥ 4 (Slika 10). Zaključimo lahko, da je ISB zelo uspešna pri lajšanju PB v času do 36 ur po operaciji. S popuščanjem učinka uspešnost pada, a je pri večini bolnikov v kombinaciji s predpisanim analgetičnim zdravljenjem po operaciji vseeno dovolj učinkovita. Menimo, da se PB pri večini naših bolnikov kakovostno in učinkovito lajša, zato vsesplošna uporaba obživčnega katetra zaradi možnosti številnih dodatnih zapletov ni smiselna in upravičena (37).

sec.title: Poraba analgetikov po operaciji
sec.p: Opioidni analgetiki so zlati standard sistemskega lajšanja PB, a imajo številne neželene učinke, zato jih v klinični praksi poskušamo v čim večji meri kombinirati in nadomestiti z neopioidnimi analgetiki, večinoma NSAR (6). Metode področne anestezije lahko občutno zmanjšajo porabo analgetikov po operaciji, zato smo to upoštevali kot enega od meril za oceno učinkovitosti. Descroches in sod. so ugotovili, da je na dan operacije po opioidnem analgetiku poseglo 61 % njihovih bolnikov. Delež bolnikov, ki so v naslednjih dveh POD vzeli opioidni analgetik, je bil 85 % (41). Pri tem je potrebno poudariti, da je visok delež med drugim posledica tega, da so imeli opioidne analgetike predpisane pri redni terapiji, a so, kot smo že poročali, kljub temu beležili višje vrednosti VAS. Tudi kasneje je število dodatnih odmerkov v drugih raziskavah višje, saj je pri Leeju in sod. na prvi POD dodaten odmerek potrebovalo 20 % bolnikov (40). Najmanjšo porabo analgetikov so ob sorazmerno učinkovitem zdravljenju beležili Malik in sod. Z uporabo UZ so pri enkratni ISB na prvi in drugi POD bolniki povprečno potrebovali 0,19 odmerka in na tretji POD 0,14 odmerka opioidnega analgetika na bolnika, kar je primerljivo z našimi rezultati (46).

Pomembno je, da pri predpisovanju opioidov natančno sledimo smernicam odmerjanja, da se izognemu neželenim učinkom opioidnega protibolečinskega zdravljenja. Opioidnih analgetikov ne predpisujemo bolnikom z znano odvisnostjo, pri vseh ostalih bolnikih pa strogo omejimo čas uporabe, da preprečimo razvoj odvisnosti (48). Glede na naše rezultate menimo, da zdravljenje z opioidi od tretjega POD dalje ni potrebno, saj je PB od 60. ure po operaciji dalje blaga ali zmerna (Slika 6). Če bolniki po tem času še vedno občutijo bolečino z VAS ≥ 4, svetujemo nadaljevanje neopioidnega protibolečinskega zdravljenja.

sec.sec-type: Vpliv gibanja na stopnjo bolečine po operaciji
sec.title: Vpliv gibanja na stopnjo bolečine po operaciji
sec.p: Fermont in Borgeat s sod. navajajo, da imajo bolniki po operaciji rame zmerno do hudo bolečino, ki se poveča med gibanjem rame (24,25).

Naši rezultati niso skladni s predvidevanji v literaturi. Pri primerjavi števila bolnikov, ki so v določenem času po operaciji pričeli z gibanjem roke, in števila bolnikov, ki so v tem času občutili vsaj zmerno PB, grafično nismo ugotovili podobnosti (Slika 9 in Slika 10). Vidimo, da število bolnikov, ki so v urah po operaciji začeli gibati, doseže svoj vrh v prvih dveh urah po operaciji, pri čemer so bolniki o VAS ≥ 4 prvič poročali šele po 12 urah, kar vidimo, da ne sovpada. Naslednja večja skupina bolnikov je z gibanjem začela po 24 urah, pri čemer na grafu prav tako ne vidimo izrazitega povečanja števila bolnikov, ki so poročali o VAS ≥ 4. V nadaljevanju nismo dokazali razlik med vrednostmi VAS v mirovanju in med gibanjem na dan operacije (Slika 5) ter razlik pri bolnikih, ki so na isti dan ocenjevali PB tako v mirovanju kot med gibanjem (Tabela 8). Zgolj s primerjavo povprečnih vrednosti bi lahko komentirali, da je PB med gibanjem manjša kot v mirovanju. Lee in sod. so ocenjevali bolečino med pasivnim razgibavanjem. Šest ur po operaciji so beležili povprečno vrednost 3,8 ter 24 ur po operaciji 5 (49). V obeh primerih so vrednosti VAS v naši raziskavi ugodnejše. Vrednosti VAS med gibanjem pri naših bolnikih so nižje celo od vrednosti v nekaterih raziskavah v mirovanju (38,41,50). Da je ISB učinkovita tudi med gibanjem, potrjuje pregledna raziskava, v kateri niso ločevali posameznih vrst AOR. Stopnja PB med gibanjem šest ur po operaciji je bila ocenjena z 1,89 v primerjavi s kontrolno skupino, ki je imela 4,73. Dan po operaciji je imela skupina ISB vrednost 4,42 in kontrolna skupina 4,55, a so se razlike izenačile v 48 urah po operaciji, ko sta obe skupini dosegli 3,97 (22).

Zaradi retrospektivne narave naše raziskave ne moremo zaključiti, da gibanje vpliva na PB, še manj, da je PB med gibanjem manjša. Z veliko gotovostjo lahko trdimo vsaj, da je blokada dovolj učinkovita pri lajšanju PB tudi med gibanjem, saj velja VAS < 4 za vsa obdobja po operaciji. Ugotovitev, da vrednosti VAS med gibanjem ne odstopajo od vrednosti v mirovanju, je dobro izhodišče za prospektivno študijo.

sec.title: Splošno počutje in zadovoljstvo bolnikov
sec.p: Večina bolnikov je počutje doma označila kot sproščeno (58 %), kar sovpada z ocenami počutja med operacijo in na oddelku (Slika 11). Le bolniki z zmerno do hudo bolečino so počutje doma označili kot zelo nelagodno, iz česar sklepamo, da je dober nadzor PB še vedno eden najpomembnejših dejavnikov za dobro počutje bolnikov. Bolniki v raziskavi Delaunaya in sod. so zadovoljstvo s celotnim posegom na lestvici 1–100 ocenili z mediano 100 (20). Manj zadovoljni so bili bolniki v raziskavi Malika in sod., v kateri so zadovoljstvo na lestvici 0–10 ocenili s 5,5 (46). 99 % bolnikov iz pregledne raziskave je bilo z ISB zadovoljnih, kar 97,8 % bi se jih še enkrat odločilo za enak postopek (23).

Ocenjujemo, da je bila večina bolnikov z ISB zadovoljna, saj je kar 26 % naših bolnikov svoje zadovoljstvo s posegom in delom zdravstvene ekipe izrazilo s posebno pohvalo. Vsekakor bi način povpraševanja o zadovoljstvu lahko izboljšali oziroma bi se lahko z bolniki z negativnimi ocenami še dodatno pogovorili. Retrospektivno namreč težko presojamo, kaj je bilo tisto, kar je bolnike še posebej motilo in jim zbujalo nelagoden občutek. Te informacije bi bile zelo koristne pri nadaljnjem razvoju metode.

sec.title: Prednosti in pomanjkljivosti raziskave
sec.p: Pomembna prednost naše raziskave je veliko število vključenih bolnikov. Vseh 150 bolnikov sta obravnavala isti anesteziolog in isti kirurg, s čimer smo si zagotovili natančne, zanesljive in primerljive rezultate predvsem pri analizi podatkov z anestezijskih listov in listov področne anestezije. Pri analizi vprašalnikov nismo vedno dobili pričakovanega števila odgovorov, saj so jih nekateri bolniki izpolnjevali pomanjkljivo, površno in napačno. Zaradi velikega števila bolnikov, vključenih v raziskavo, in primerljivih pogojev posega pa menimo, da so tudi ti podatki zanesljivi.

Poleg retrospektivnosti, nesodelovanja nekaterih bolnikov in zapletenega vprašalnika pred operacijo sta največji pomanjkljivosti naše raziskave, da nismo ocenjevali bolečine ter neželenih učinkov LA in kortikosteroidov. Nimamo podatka o tem, kako se je bolečina spreminjala, nismo povpraševali po času, ki je minil od poškodbe, da bi izvedeli, kako dolgo je bolečina prisotna. Pomembne so ugotovitve, da pri bolnikih, ki imajo bolečine pred operacijo, področne metode lajšanja PB naj ne bi bile učinkovite zaradi prej povečane vzdražnosti nevronov v bolečinski poti v zadnjih rogovih hrbtenjače. Prepričani smo, da je ocena stopnje bolečine pred operacijo pri vseh nadaljnjih raziskavah nepogrešljivi del dokumentacije (51,52). V prihodnosti bi bilo smiselno raziskati neželene učinke LA in deksametazona, katerega učinkovitost je pri perinevralni uporabi glede na literaturo vprašljiva (33,34). Vsekakor bi bilo zanimivo primerjati tudi količino uporabljenega lokalnega anestetika s trajanjem motorične in senzorične blokade ter pojavom in jakostjo PB, česar v naši raziskavi nismo mogli, saj so vsi bolniki prejeli enak odmerek LA.

sec.title: Zaključek
sec.p: S svojimi ugotovitvami smo postavili dobre temelje za načrtovanje izvedbe prospektivne študije s posebnim poudarkom na učinkovitosti ISB pri lajšanju PB med pasivnim in aktivnim gibanjem. Zaključujemo, da je metoda ISB učinkovita pri lajšanju PB po artroskopski rekonstrukciji RM v domačem okolju tudi več kot 24 ur po operaciji. Metoda zagotavlja dober nadzor PB (VAS < 4) tako v mirovanju kot tudi med gibanjem ter zmanjša porabo tako opioidnih kot tudi neopiodnih analgetikov, zato vsesplošna uporaba obživčnega katetra ni smiselna in upravičena. Bolniki so z enkratno ISB zadovoljni, zato ocenjujemo, da je trenutno najprimernejša metoda pri AOR in po njej.

title-group.article-title: The efficacy of an interscalene brachial plexus block in relieving postoperative pain after an arthroscopic rotator cuff reconstruction: Retrospective study
title-group.alt-title: Učinkovitost medskalenske blokade brahialnega pleteža pri lajšanju pooperacijske bolečine

aff.institution: Faculty of medicine, University of Ljubljana, Ljubljana, Slovenia
Kirurgija Bitenc, d. o. o., Ljubljana, Slovenia

abstract.title: Abstract
abstract.p: Background: Rotator cuff tears are among the most common causes for an arthroscopic shoulder surgery. Movement of the limb is essential for successful recovery and paramount for well controlled postoperative pain (POP). The efficacy of the interscalene brachial plexus block (ISB) in relieving POP in homecare setting was evaluated. The research is expected to call our attention to the shortcomings of ISB and point out a possible need to adjust the prescribed oral analgesic therapy.

Methods: A retrospective analysis of 150 patients was conducted. They had all undergone arthroscopic shoulder surgery due to the rotator cuff tear and received 12–30 mL levobupivacaine with dexamethasone preoperatively with ultrasound-guided ISB. POP was assessed with the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS). Patients’ demographical and clinical features were assessed as well as the duration of ISB and the analgesics consumption. VAS values were analysed 90 hours after surgery at rest and on movement. Patients’ satisfaction was assessed as well. Wilcoxon rank-sum test was used for comparison of the VAS values between descriptive variables. In the analysis of different levels of POP within the same patient, Repeated Measures Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) was used. A value of p < 0.05 was considered statistically significant.

Results: The mean duration of ISB effect was 24–36 hours. In total, 77 additional doses of opioids and 104 doses of non-opioid analgesics were required during the first three post-operative days (POD). The median VAS value of the early POP was 0, both at rest and on movement. POP was 0.5 on movement and 1 at rest on the first POD, 2 and 3 on the second POD, 2 and 2 on the third POD. No significant differences were found between POP on movement and at rest (p > 0.05; Repeated Measures ANOVA). Most patients had been comfortable during surgery as well as later on the ward and at home.

Conclusion: ISB is effective in relieving POP after arthroscopic rotator cuff repair in home care after hospital discharge. It provides more than 24-hour analgesia, but can cause intra-operative haemodynamic instability. The prescribed analgesic therapy is efficient. VAS values are satisfactory at rest and on movement. ISB is safe, uncomplicated and reliable in addition to high patients’ satisfaction. We conclude that ISB is the most appropriate method for arthroscopic shoulder surgery.

sec.title: Introduction
sec.p: Shoulder pain is the third most common disease of the musculoskeletal system, causing a high socio-economic burden as it affects 67 % of the population (1). One of the most common causes of shoulder pain is the tear of the rotator cuff (RC) muscle tendon, which occurs in 13 % of people over the age of 50 and 50 % of people over the age of 80 (2). The goal of RC surgery is to reduce pain while improving the function (3). Experts favour regional anaesthesia for shoulder arthroscopy (SA), as it provides excellent muscle relaxation, reduced blood loss, decreased patient length of stay, and reduced need for intra- and postoperative analgesia. Above all, it reduces the risk of intraoperative hypotension and related decreased cerebral perfusion, which is particularly important for SA in a beach-chair position (4).

fig.label: Figure 1:

caption.p: Diagram of the course of patient selection for the retrospective analysis.

fig.p: Legend: SA (shoulder arthroscopy), RC (rotator cuff), ISB (Interscalene Brachial Plexus Block).

sec.p: Post-operative pain (POP) is acute pain that is defined as a biochemical and behavioural cascade initiated as a response to tissue damage during surgery (5,6). According to the German survey, SA is ranked 70th in terms of POP scores on the first postoperative day (POD) (6). Ineffective POP management is, in addition to its subsequent development to chronic pain, associated with the onset of deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, myocardial ischemia, myocardial infarction and pneumonia, poor wound healing, insomnia, and increased morbidity and mortality. Moreover, it is associated with economic and medical implications and patient dissatisfaction with medical care (6,7). Effective POP management is particularly important after orthopaedic procedures, otherwise, patients are admitted to the hospital instead of being discharged to home care after day-case surgery, and POP also prolongs their recovery time (8).

fig.label: Figure 2:

caption.p: Simulation of ultrasound-guided interscalene brachial plexus block.

fig.p: The anesthesiologist shows the site of the injection during the simulation of the interscalene brachial plexus block. Author: Ana Kisovar.

sec.p: Peripheral nerve blocks are a very popular method for relieving POP due to their effectiveness. We utilize different approaches and techniques that use different quantities and types of local anaesthetics (LA) (9). The most commonly used and most effective standalone approach to the brachial plexus is between the scalene muscles and is known as an Interscalene Brachial Plexus Block, ISB (10).

fig.label: Figure 3:

caption.p: Ultrasound view of the brachial plexus between the anterior and middle scalene muscle.

fig.p: Legend: SA (anterior scalene muscle), SM (middle scalene muscle), SCM (sternocleidomastoid muscle), C5-C7 (cervical spinal nerves). Source: Kirurgija Bitenc d. o. o. archives

sec.p: All the nerves that are important in RC surgery originate from the cervical roots C5 and C6, that is, from the posterior and upper trunks of the brachial plexus. This is the basis for the ISB method, where the anaesthesiologist targets the brachial plexus at the level of its trunks, thereby successfully blocking multiple peripheral nerves at the same time (10). The most direct approach to the brachial plexus in the space between the anterior and middle scalene muscle remains the Winnie’s technique, which has undergone some modifications since being first described in 1970 (11,12).

The clinical practice most often utilizes a multimodal approach, i.e., the simultaneous use of various local and systemic methods for pain relief. The combination of paracetamol, non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), and weak opioid analgesics with nerve blockage provides effective POP relief. Patients may leave the hospital on the day of the surgery and recover safely and pain-free in their home environment (13).

The present retrospective study sought to verify the effectiveness of the ISB method that is routinely used in SA to relieve POP outside the hospital setting. We aimed to determine whether it achieves a sufficiently long analgesic effect without concomitant motor block, which significantly impedes early recovery. Therefore, we evaluated the efficacy of ISBs in relieving POP at different time intervals after SA, both at rest and on movement of the treated limb, and examined the possible impact of activity levels on POP. The results of the analysis will help us develop hypotheses for a prospective study that will allow us to more closely examine POP during movement and physical therapy.

sec.title: Study design
sec.p: We conducted a retrospective study evaluating the efficacy of ISB in relieving POP after arthroscopic RC reconstruction. The analysis was performed between May 2017 and August 2018 in collaboration with Arbor mea d. o. o. and Kirurgija Bitenc d. o. o. (Surgery Bitenc). On 23rd January 2018, before starting data collection and analyses, we obtained the approval of the National Medical Ethics Committee of the Republic of Slovenia (0120–628 / 2017/6). The patients we included in the study consented to the ISB method before the intervention and were over 18 years old. They were anesthetized by the same anaesthesiologist and the surgery was performed by the same surgeon. We subsequently excluded patients who had not undergone shoulder surgery for RC tear and those who had submitted incomplete questionnaires. We retrospectively analysed data of 150 referred patients with a clinical diagnosis of shoulder RC tear, where the surgeon arthroscopically reconstructed the RC in a beach-chair surgical position and simultaneously performed a subacromial decompression (Figure 1).

caption.p: Prescribed postoperative analgesic treatment after surgery

sec.title: Practical part of the study
sec.p: Ultrasound-guided ISB was performed according to the modified Winnie’s method (14). For the block we used 12–30 mL of 0.5 % solution of LA levobupivacaine with the addition of 8 mg of dexamethasone, depending on the patient’s body weight. The block’s efficiency was evaluated 15 and 30 minutes after ISB. During surgery, patients were sedated with 1 mg/kg/h of propofol and 0.01 μg/kg/min of remifentanil. Patients’ vital functions were continuously monitored throughout the procedure. In the event that oxygen saturation dropped below 93 %, patients received additional oxygen by face mask (Figure 2 and Figure 3).

On the day of the surgery patients received a POP assessment questionnaire with instructions, which they began completing two hours after the procedure. Patients’ POP scores were assessed using the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) provided on the questionnaire. Generally, they were discharged from the hospital with detailed recovery instructions on the same day when they reached a satisfactory grade according to the Aldrete scoring system (15).

caption.p: Histogram of the first recorded postoperative VAS > 0.

sec.p: All patients were instructed to take oral analgesic metamizole 500 mg for the first time 12 hours after ISB. Pain management protocol for the following 3 days is presented in the table (Table 1). Patients with previous problems with NSAIDs were prescribed tramadol with paracetamol instead of diclofenac. If the prescribed medication were insufficient, additional analgesic treatment was advised if necessary (Table 2, Figure 5).

caption.p: Prescribed additional postoperative analgesic treatment after surgery.

tr.td: Up to 8 tablets with mild pain
Up to 8 tablets with moderate pain

sec.title: Analytical part of the study
sec.p: Data were collected using the anaesthesia record sheet, regional anaesthesia record sheet, and the questionnaire. The anaesthesia record sheet and regional anaesthesia record sheet were used to obtain data on: surgical diagnosis, the type and amount of LA, comorbidities, and the ASA score (the American Society of Anesthesiologists’ physical status classification). In addition to POP at rest and on movement, the questionnaire provided information on the subjective assessment of the patient’s well-being and pain during the administration of the block, during surgery, after surgery on the ward, and the duration of the ISB effect. Early POP scores included those on the day of surgery, i.e., up to 12 hours after surgery, the first postoperative day was considered as 18–36 hours after surgery, the second POD as 42–60 hours after surgery, and the third POD 66–90 hours after surgery.

fig.label: Figure 5:

caption.p: Graphic representation of the highest level of pain on the day of surgery at rest and on movement.

fig.p: The highest VAS value on the day of the surgery in terms of activity is expressed by the median (thicker longer line) and the interquartile range (thinner shorter line). Dots and squares show individual patient ratings. There were no statistically significant differences between the values (p > 0.05; Wilcoxon rank-sum test).

sec.p: We used the Statistical Package for the Social Sciences 23.0 for statistical data analysis. In addition to M ± SD, numerical variables were also described by Me and IQR. The VAS value was considered as a non-normally distributed relative numerical variable when estimating the differences, however, the mean value with standard deviation (SD) is also stated for easier comparison with some data from the literature (16,17). Wilcoxon rank-sum test and Kruskal-Wallis H test were used to compare VAS values with descriptive variables. For the analysis of measures performed on the same patient, two-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) for repeated measures was used according to the recommendations without or with previous normalization (17). A p-value of < 0.05 was considered statistically significant.

sec.title: Characteristics of study subjects
sec.p: We retrospectively analysed 150 patients after SA due to RC tear, where 88 (59 %) were men and 62 (41 %) were women. The demographic and clinical characteristics of the patients are shown in the tables (Table 3 and Table 4) (Figure 4).

caption.p: Demographic characteristics of the subjects.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legend: M (average value), SD (standard deviation), Min (lowest value), Max (highest value), Me (median), IZ (interval zaupanja), IQR (interquartile range).

sec.title: Duration of the block
sec.p: The duration of ISB was assessed in two ways. For the first assessment of the duration of ISB, we recorded a time interval for each patient from the time of ISB provision to the time recorded by the patient as the time when the arm was felt in full as before the block. According to this assessment, ISB was effective for 31 ± 8 hours on average (Me = 29; IQR = 9). The shortest estimated time of duration was 18 hours and the longest was 55 hours.

caption.p: Risk assessment scale.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legend: ASA (American Society of Anesthesiologists’ Physical Status Classification), n (number of patients), d (proportion of patients).

sec.p: A group of 21 patients had not recorded VAS > 0 after surgery, so they were excluded from the second assessment. In 129 patients, we determined the time interval when VAS > 0 was first recorded during recovery after surgery (Figure 4). The second assessment of duration established that 71 (56 %) patients first experienced POP 24–36 hours after surgery, which corresponds to the interquartile range from the first assessment (25–34 hours). By comparing the two assessments of ISB duration we can conclude that the block is, on average, effective for 24 to 36 hours.

fig.label: Figure 6:

caption.p: Graphic representation of postoperative changes in VAS values in hours.

fig.p: The continuous line connects the median values of VAS (visual analogue scale - coloured dot) with the interquartile range (thinner shorter line) in the hours after surgery in all patients together, regardless of activity. The medians on the same day are shown in the same colour.

sec.title: Early postoperative pain
sec.p: Pain up to 12 hours after surgery was defined as early postoperative pain, which means POP on the day of the surgery. Patients recorded VAS values at two-hour intervals after surgery, while also reporting on their activity, location of pain, and the possible need for additional analgesics. The efficacy of ISB was tested both at rest and on movement, therefore, we analysed patients’ highest recorded VAS values on the day of surgery according to activity (Figure 5). The mean peak VAS values with standard deviation were 0.8 ± 1.7 at rest and 0.7 ± 1.7 on movement. Comparing the values found no statistically significant differences (p = 0.860; Wilcoxon rank-sum test).

On the day of the surgery 6 (2 %) patients required an additional dose of analgesics. Most were treated with analgin (metamizole) or diclofenac, and one patient received piritramide on the ward on the day of the surgery.

sec.title: Late postoperative pain
sec.p: Late POP was defined as pain after 18 hours post-surgery or in the first three PODs (Table 5, Table 6, Table 7). To assess late POP, patients recorded VAS values at six-hour intervals (Figure 6) and also reported on their activity and the possible need for additional analgesics.

caption.p: VAS values on the third postoperative day.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legend: VAS (Visual Analogue Scale), n (number of responses), M (average value), SD (standard deviation), Min (lowest value), Max (highest value), Me (median), IQR (interquartile range).

fig.label: Figure 7:

caption.p: Histogram of postoperative consumption of additional doses of opioid analgesics.

fig.p: Patients needed a total of 77 additional doses of opioid analgesics in the first three days after surgery.

sec.p: In addition to the prescribed medications, patients also recorded the usage of additional analgesics (Figure 7 and Figure 8). Patients required 77 additional doses of opioid analgesics and 104 additional doses of non-opioid analgesics in the first three days after surgery. Within the first POD, 10 (7 %) patients required an additional dose of an opioid and 18 (12 %) patients an additional dose of non-opioid analgesics. On average, 0.09 additional doses of opioid and 0.17 additional doses of non-opioid analgesics were used per patient. On the second POD, 15 (10 %) patients required an additional dose of an opioid, and 28 (19 %) patients required an additional dose of a non-opioid analgesic. On average, 0.21 additional doses of opioid and 0.27 additional doses of non-opioid analgesics were used per patient. On the third POD, 10 (7 %) patients required an additional dose of an opioid, and 22 (15 %) patients required an additional dose of a non-opioid analgesic. On average, 0.21 additional doses of opioid and 0.26 additional doses of non-opioid analgesics were used per patient.

caption.p: VAS values on the first postoperative day.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legend: VAS (Visual Analogue Scale), n (number of responses), M (average value), SD (standard deviation), Min (lowest value), Max (highest value), Me (median), IQR (interquartile range).

sec.sec-type: The effect of movement on the level of postoperative pain
sec.title: The effect of movement on the level of postoperative pain
sec.p: Using the questionnaires, we determined the time when patients first began to move their arms after surgery (Figure 9) in order to be able to graphically compare the distribution of patients who rated POP ≥ 4 in the hours after surgery (Figure 10).

We separately analysed VAS values in patients who assessed POP on the same day both at rest and on movement (Table 8), but found no statistically significant differences (p > 0.05; ANOVA for repeated measures).

caption.p: VAS values on the second postoperative day.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legend: VAS (Visual Analogue Scale), n (number of responses), M (average value), SD (standard deviation), Min (lowest value), Max (highest value), Me (median), IQR (interquartile range).

sec.title: General well-being and patient satisfaction
sec.p: One patient reported feeling very uncomfortable during surgery; the patient also reported feeling uncomfortable during the administration of the nerve block and assessed the pain during the block as 4–6 on the VAS scale. Feeling as very uncomfortable at home was reported by 5 patients who rated POP on the first, second, and third POD with VAS > 5. As many as 39 (26 %) patients expressed their satisfaction with the procedure with a written compliment to the entire medical team (Figure 11).

sec.title: Discussion
sec.p: Effectively relieving POP means that the analgesic method easily and reliably provides good POP management, which experientially and according to the literature means VAS values < 4 (18). ISB is routinely used in SA and has been shown to be effective for up to 24 hours after surgery (19-23). In these studies, the authors did not assess pain on movement or during physiotherapy exercises, both fundamental for a successful recovery. Some authors state that POP is thought to be higher on movement than at rest and to increase further with arm-overhead activities (24,25). The efficacy of analgesic therapy after surgery when already at home is also less well known, as patients are known to experience moderate (VAS = 4–6) to severe (VAS = 7–9) POP more than 48 hours after surgery, when, as a rule, they are already recovering in the home environment (14).

fig.label: Figure 8:

caption.p: Histogram of postoperative consumption of additional doses of non-opioid analgesics.

fig.p: Patients needed a total of 104 additional doses of non-opioid analgesics in the first three days after surgery.

sec.title: Duration of single-shot nerve block
sec.p: The duration of the nerve block depends on the volume, concentration, and type of LA, and also additional medicines (19,26-31). The duration of the nerve block is significantly shorter in studies without the addition of corticosteroids when compared to our patients (14,21,22,31). A slightly prolonged duration is reported by authors who added dexamethasone to the LA. Tanaka et al. reported a median of 18 hours with 20 mL of 0.75 % ropivacaine and additional dexamethasone, while Cummings et al. reported a median of 22.4 hours (32), but used 30 mL of 0.75 % ropivacaine. These authors’ findings are supported by some recent findings that corticosteroids prolong LA duration time and at the same time opposed by some studies that question the effect of either systemic or local corticosteroid addition on the duration of the perineural block (33-35).

caption.p: Histogram of the number of patients who initiated movement in the hours after surgery.

sec.p: Nevertheless, the significant deviations cannot be attributed to corticosteroids alone, regardless of their interaction. An explanation also cannot be found in the experience of the anaesthesiologist, as differences in the success rate of ultrasound-guided ISB with respect to experience have not been demonstrated (36). The best explanation so far is offered by Tangoca et al., who differentiated the duration of ISB into the duration of analgesia and the duration of motor block. The mean duration of analgesia was 21.6 hours and the mean duration of the motor block was 36.7 hours (37). It should be noted that in assessing the duration of ISB, our patients answered the question ´When did you fully feel the arm?´. This can mean both the time to feel POP as well as the time to regain the feeling of touch and muscle strength and explains the range of time recorded (18–55 hours). We find that the question should be formulated more precisely and that the overlap of the duration of analgesia and the duration of the motor and sensory block was probably a coincidence.

caption.p: Histogram of the number of patients who assessed pain with VAS ≥ 4 in the hours after surgery.

sec.p: Nonetheless, the assessment of the duration of the block is clinically important, as it is desirable that analgesia lasts as long as possible, while we want motor strength to be restored sooner so that patients can begin moving their arm. Based on the graphic presentation (Figure 6), we suggest that patients be informed in advance that POP will start to escalate 24 hours after the procedure and will reach its peak in approximately 42 hours. It should also be emphasized that they should take the prescribed analgesics regularly at least within the timeframe, even if they are not in pain (14).

caption.p: Histogram of general well-being of patients during surgery, on the ward, and at home.

sec.title: Level of POP
sec.p: Patients after SA due to RC tear are known to experience severe POP up to 48 hours after surgery (38,39). We recorded POP levels for up to 90 hours and in their comparison included studies evaluating the efficacy of ISB after SA due to RC tear and resting POP recorded with VAS. Lee et al. reported an average level of 5.2 six hours after surgery (40); similar results were found by the study of Ikemota et al., reporting an average of 6.27, however, their subsequent values were comparable to ours (38). Closer to our values were Desroches et al., who reported an average of 2.3 six hours after surgery (41). The differences in POP values might be explained by the fact that Lee et al. used a nerve stimulator to conduct the ISB, while both Desroches and Ikemoto et al. used neither ultrasound nor a nerve stimulator. It is known that the use of ultrasound improves the quality of the block and prolongs its efficacy (42). Desroches et al. recorded higher average values on the first and second POD (4.5 and 4.2, respectively) and slightly lower on the third POD with 3.1 (41). Similar results were found by Salviz et al. (43). Our patients rated POP levels 24 hours after surgery with a median of 0. The results of other studies were also higher within this timeframe. Lee et al. reported an average of 3.9 (40) and Ikemoto et al. an average value of 3.8. Only the latter also assessed POP within 48 hours after surgery and found that the mean value was 3.0 (38), which is comparable to our median. According to the VAS values, we concluded that these ISB were effective for approximately 24 hours. Therefore, according to the estimate of the ISB efficacy, patients in these studies were expected to record higher POP levels on the first POD (24 hours after surgery), while our patients recorded the worst POP later, i.e., on the second POD (42 hours after surgery). Then again, we should emphasize that these authors recorded higher rates in both early and late POP.

We were also interested in knowing whether continuous ISB could provide even better quality analgesia. According to Frederickson et al. this method is the most effective for relieving POP after SA, as the administration of LA via a perineural catheter prolongs analgesia after surgery (44). Despite many advantages, the main obstacles to routine use are inconsistencies in its provision technique, prolonged motor block, catheter dislodgement, infection, pump failure, and the fact that the use of a perineural catheter is currently only possible in hospitalized patients (45). In studies with a continuous ISB, the authors reported a median VAS value of 0 on the first POD, which reached a value of 3 on the second and third PODs. In the same study, medians 4. 4, and 3 were obtained for a single-shot ISB (46). Interestingly, the efficacy of the continuous method is mainly reflected in the first two PODs, while the POP values are later equalized. Our median values of 1, 3, and 2 are slightly higher than for the aforementioned continuous ISB but lower than single-shot ISB (39,46).

Having VAS values that are comparable or lower to those in similar studies in both early and late POP, and also with continuous ISB is good. Despite satisfactory median values, we can observe that VAS values exceed the limit set as satisfactory (VAS < 4) when considering the interquartile ranges after 36 hours (Figure 6). At that time, the number of patients who assessed POP with a VAS ≥ 4 also increased significantly (Figure 10). We can conclude that ISB is very successful in relieving POP in the timeframe of up to 36 hours after surgery. The efficacy of the block decreases as it wears off, but in combination with the prescribed analgesic treatment after surgery, it is still sufficiently effective in most patients. We believe that most of our patients are provided with quality and effective POP relief, so the general use of a perineural catheter is not sensible and justified due to the possibility of many additional complications (37).

sec.title: Postoperative consumption of analgesics
sec.p: Opioid analgesics are the gold standard of systemic POP relief, but carry a number of side effects; in clinical practice, we try to combine and replace them as much as possible with non-opioid analgesics, mostly NSAIDs (6). Methods of regional anaesthesia can significantly reduce the consumption of analgesics after surgery, thus, we considered this as one of the criteria for assessing efficacy. Descroches et al. found that 61 % of their patients took an opioid analgesic on the day of the surgery. The proportion of patients who took an opioid analgesic in the next two PODs was 85 % (41). It should be emphasized that the high proportion is a result of, among other things, the fact that they had opioid analgesics prescribed as regular therapy; then again, as previously reported, they nevertheless recorded higher VAS values. The number of additional doses in other studies is higher even later on, as in Lee et al., where 20 % of patients required an additional dose on the first POD (40). The lowest consumption rate of analgesics with relatively effective treatment was recorded by Malik et al. Using ultrasound guidance, a single-shot ISB required an average of 0.19 doses per patient on the first and second PODs and a 0.14 dose of opioid analgesic per patient on the third POD, which is comparable to our results (46).

It is imperative to carefully follow dosing guidelines when prescribing opioids to avoid the side effects of opioid pain management. Opioid analgesics are not prescribed to patients with known dependence, and the time of use is strictly limited in all other patients to prevent the development of dependence (48). Based on our results, we believe that opioid treatment from the third POD onwards is not necessary, as POP is mild or moderate after 60 hours post-surgery (Figure 6). Non-opioid analgesic therapy is recommended if patients still experience pain with a VAS ≥ 4 after this timeframe.

caption.p: Highest VAS values at rest and on movement in patients who assessed the level of pain in both activities on the same day.

table-wrap-foot.p: Legend: Max (highest value), VAS (Visual Analogue Scale), n (number of patients), M (average value), SD (standard deviation), Me (median), IQR (interquartile range), p (p-value), POD (postoperative day).

sec.sec-type: Impact of movement on POP levels
sec.title: Impact of movement on POP levels
sec.p: Fermont and Borgeat et al. report that patients have moderate to severe pain after shoulder surgery that increases during shoulder movement (24,25).

Our results do not coincide with predictions in the literature. When comparing the number of patients initiating arm movements at a certain time after the surgery and the number of patients who experienced at least moderate POP during this time, we graphically found no similarities (Figure 9 and Figure 10). We can observe that the number of patients who initiated movement within hours after surgery reaches its peak in the first two hours after surgery, while patients first reported VAS ≥ 4 only after 12 hours, which does not coincide. The next larger group of patients initiated movement after 24 hours, while the graph also does not show a significant increase in the number of patients who reported VAS ≥ 4. Further below we did not demonstrate any differences between VAS values at rest and on movement on the day of the surgery (Figure 5) or differences in patients who assessed POP on the same day both at rest and on movement (Table 8).

Simply comparing the average values, one could observe that POP is lower on movement than at rest. Lee et al. assessed pain during passive movement. Six hours after surgery they recorded an average of 3.8 and 24 hours after surgery an average of 5 (49). VAS values are more favourable in our study in both cases. In our patients, VAS values on movement are even lower than values in some studies at rest (38,41,50). ISB effectiveness during movement is confirmed by a review study that did not differentiate individual types of SA. POP levels on movement six hours after surgery were assessed at 1.89 compared with a control group values of 4.73. The day after the surgery, the ISB group had a value of 4.42 and the control group 4.55, but the differences levelled within 48 hours after surgery when both groups reached 3.97 (22).

Due to the retrospective nature of our study, we cannot conclude that movement affects POP, or even less likely to state that POP is lower on movement. However, we can at least say with great certainty that the block is sufficiently effective in relieving POP even on movement, as VAS < 4 applies to all periods after surgery. The conclusion that VAS values on movement do not differ from values at rest is a good starting point for a prospective study.

sec.title: General well-being and patient satisfaction
sec.p: Most patients rated their well-being at home as relaxed (58 %), which coincided with their assessments of well-being during surgery and on the ward (Figure 11). Only patients with moderate to severe pain rated their well-being at home as very uncomfortable, suggesting that good POP management is still one of the most important factors for patient well-being. Patients in the study by Delaunaya et al. rated their satisfaction with the entire procedure on a scale of 1–100 with a median of 100 (20). Patients were less satisfied in a study by Malika et al., where satisfaction was rated at 5.5 on a scale of 0–10 (46). As many as 99 % of patients from the review study were satisfied with ISB, and 97.8 % would choose the same procedure again (23).

We estimate that the majority of patients were satisfied with the ISB method, as 26 % of our patients expressed their satisfaction with the procedure and the work of the medical team with special appreciation. Regardless, our inquiry on patient satisfaction could be improved or we could reach out to patients with negative ratings for an additional consult. In retrospect, it is difficult to determine what it was that particularly displeased our patients and made them feel uncomfortable. This information would be very useful in future advancements of the method.

sec.sec-type: Advantages and disadvantages of the study
sec.title: Advantages and disadvantages of the study
sec.p: An important advantage of our study is the large number of participants. All 150 patients were treated by the same anaesthesiologist and the same surgeon, thus ensuring accurate, reliable, and comparable results, especially when analysing data from anaesthesia record sheets and regional anaesthesia record sheets. We did not consistently obtain the expected number of responses when analysing the questionnaires, as some patients completed them inadequately, superficially, and incorrectly. However, we consider these data reliable due to the large number of patients included in the study and the comparable circumstances of the procedure.

In addition to the retrospective nature of the study, non-participation of some patients, and a complex preoperative questionnaire, we find not evaluating the pain and side effects of LA and corticosteroids as the biggest shortcomings of our study. We have no data on how the pain had changed, we have not inquired about the time passed since the injury to establish how long the pain has been present. Importantly, in patients with preoperative pain, regional methods of relieving POP are not expected to be effective due to previously increased excitability of neurons in the pain pathway in the posterior horns of the spinal cord. We believe that the assessment of the level of pain before surgery is an essential part of the records in all further research (51,52). Future research should focus on the side effects of LA and dexamethasone, whose efficacy in perineural use is questionable according to the literature (33,34). Regardless, it would be interesting to compare the dosage of LA used with the duration of motor and sensory block and the occurrence and severity of POP, which we could not do in our study, as all patients received the same dose of LA.

sec.title: Conclusion
sec.p: Our findings have laid a good basis to plan the implementation of a prospective study that would place a special emphasis on the efficacy of ISB in relieving POP during passive and active movement. We conclude that the ISB method is effective in relieving POP after arthroscopic reconstruction of RC in the home environment even past the mark of 24 hours after surgery. The method provides good POP management (VAS < 4) both at rest and on movement and reduces the consumption of both opioid and non-opioid analgesics, so the general use of a perineural catheter is not sensible nor justified. Patients are satisfied with a single-shot ISB, hence, we estimate that it is currently the most appropriate method for SA and the period after.
